\section*{\begin{picture}(20,0) \put(-5,-10){\includegraphics*[width=1cm]{/www/erowid.org/experiences/images/erologo_1cm_600dpi_greyscale}} \end{picture} Erowid Experience Vaults Report Id: 66890}

\subsection*{Just a Taste}
\vspace{-0.2cm}
by \emph{Bloodlvst}
\vspace{0.5cm}
\thispagestyle{plain}

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|c|c|c|}
\hline
Dose:  T+ 0:00 & 400 mg & oral & Modafinil & daily\\
\hline
 T+ 0:00 & 50 mg & oral & Pharms - Sertraline & daily\\
\hline
 T+ 0:00 & 50 mg & oral & Pharms - Aripiprazole & daily\\
\hline
 T+ 0:00 & 1 tsp & oral & Absinthe & \\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{1mm}

\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|}
\hline
Body weight: & 220.00 lbs\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{2mm}
As I write this, I am still slightly intoxicated. I have been experimenting with the creation of absinthe-like-beverages for quite some time now and I feel I have succeeded.



The color: A beautiful clear yellow-green



The louche: A surprisingly beautiful cream-white or bone-white with a slight yellow tinge.



The taste: bitter but also quite sweet, the sugar at the bottom of the glass makes it nearly syrupy, strong Anise, hints of Juniper, mint, and the slightest aftertaste of something a bit like Cannabis.



The feelings: even diluted, there is a slight burn as it hits my tongue and a warmth as it hits my stomach. The effect is nearly immediate, my thought processes are completely different, I don't feel particularly creative, as such, but I feel a sense of\ldots .'poetry' in my surroundings, almost as though I could spend years describing, in intimate detail, the precise nature of one thing without fear of boredom.



I am quite calm but I am not tired at all, I think I shall go make myself a cup of tea and read a nice book.



Cheers.

\end{document}
